Telesale Executive Officer Job at PC Planet Limited




        
    

        
        PC Planet Limited is Nigeria’s leading Online IT vendor, offering a large variety of IT products and services, at unbeatable low prices while providing our customers a superior and exciting shopping experience.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Telesale Executive Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Responsibilties
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Lead Generation & Customer Engagement: Actively identify and contact potential customers online and through phone to generate sales leads and build a client base.
	Product Expertise: Develop a thorough understanding of computer hardware, software, and peripherals to effectively communicate features, benefits, and technical specifications to customers.
	Sales & Negotiation: Present products, answer customer questions, explain technical details, and negotiate prices and terms to secure sales.
	Customer Relationship Management: Maintain and grow profitable relationships with customers by providing excellent service, handling queries, and following up on leads and inquiries.
	Sales Target Achievement: Work independently or with a team to meet or exceed monthly or quarterly sales goals and drive revenue for the company.
	Market & Trend Awareness: Stay informed about the latest technology trends, online marketing strategies, and competitor activities.


Essential Skills & Qualifications


	Education: A High School Diploma or GED is a minimum requirement, though Degrees in Business, Marketing, or Computer Science can be beneficial.
	Experience: Telesale, Client Service, Customer Service, Sales
	Communication & Customer Service: Exceptional ability to communicate effectively through various digital platforms and provide outstanding customer service.
	Technical Aptitude: Basic to strong knowledge of computers, Hardware and related IT terminology.
	Sales & Persuasion: Strong persuasion and negotiation skills to overcome objections and close deals.
	Organization & Self-Motivation: Ability to manage multiple tasks, prioritize work, and remain self-motivated to achieve sales targets.
	Digital Tools Proficiency: Familiarity with online sales tools, CRM systems, and communication platforms (like email, chat, and phone


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@pcplaceng.com or pcplacenigeria@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Account Officer",
  "description": "Aeroport Travels and Tours Limited is a full fledged travel management company located in Lagos, Nigeria. At ATTL, we strive to provide our customers with the very best service in the industry today. We are committed to offering travel services of the highest quality, combining our energy, enthusiasm and years of vast experiences. Our greatest satisfaction comes in serving large numbers of satisfied clients who have experienced the joys and inspiration of travel. Our Services includes: Flight Ticket, Hotel Accommodation, Tour/Corporate Packages, Visa Advisory, Protocol Services, Travel Insurance, Aviation Trainings e.t.c. Ever since our establishment, ATTL has concentrated its efforts in producing quality travel, responding to the needs of the times while anticipating the demands of the future. You will discover that we do things differently. We use our diversity in and out of the travel industry to address various global concerns.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Oshodi / Ajao Estate - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Account Officer (College &amp; Travel Division) will provide financial, administrative, and clerical support across both the Travel &amp; Tours and College units of the organization.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, processing transactions, reconciling accounts, and supporting departmental financial reporting in line with institutional standards and regulatory requirements.


General Financial Duties


	Maintain up-to-date and accurate financial records across the College and Travel &amp; Tours divisions.
	Process and record all income, expenses, and transactions promptly and correctly.
	Handle invoicing, payments, collections, and receipts for clients, vendors, and students.
	Conduct regular reconciliations of bank accounts, petty cash, and departmental ledgers.
